# The `AtomicRMWInst` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

an instruction that atomically reads a memory location, combines it with another value, and then stores the result back. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Declaration

<CodeBlock>class llvm::AtomicRMWInst</CodeBlock>

## Description {#details}

an instruction that atomically reads a memory location, combines it with another value, and then stores the result back.

Returns the old value.

Definition at line 704 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/instructions-h">Instructions.h</a>.

## Enumerations

### enum  {#a461cfbbb5c7a57ab73210498923cf615}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="enum llvm::AtomicRMWInst::BinOp : unsigned">
This enumeration lists the possible modifications atomicrmw can make.

<EnumerationList title="Enumeration values">

<Link id="a461cfbbb5c7a57ab73210498923cf615afc870a548088c5b7a93a34f648889d77" />
<EnumerationListItem name="Xchg">
&#42;p = v
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="a461cfbbb5c7a57ab73210498923cf615a0794c42b44989f9d9f1454d79ca0dd88" />
<EnumerationListItem name="Add">
&#42;p = old + v
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="a461cfbbb5c7a57ab73210498923cf615a5db6ca0c3e18acd87290f22ccb2ce564" />
<EnumerationListItem name="Sub">
&#42;p = old - v
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="a461cfbbb5c7a57ab73210498923cf615a660a31179bfecd737a256372e5fd6122" />
<EnumerationListItem name="And">
&#42;p = old &amp; v
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="a461cfbbb5c7a57ab73210498923cf615afdcdc631cf4fa6829fd7499cd06a306b" />
<EnumerationListItem name="Nand">
&#42;p = ~(old &amp; v)
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="a461cfbbb5c7a57ab73210498923cf615a5954f59053121b87ebe0c5fe79942c6e" />
<EnumerationListItem name="Or">
&#42;p = old | v
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="a461cfbbb5c7a57ab73210498923cf615a71aab8ee954b6d71a4eed315e8f6556e" />
<EnumerationListItem name="Xor">
&#42;p = old ^ v
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="a461cfbbb5c7a57ab73210498923cf615aa1184a7e35e94d162a2d40f2b11beeb2" />
<EnumerationListItem name="Max">
&#42;p = old &gt;signed v ? old : v
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="a461cfbbb5c7a57ab73210498923cf615a39edb6e51c1ad37244e8b32a2af4077d" />
<EnumerationListItem name="Min">
&#42;p = old &lt;signed v ? old : v
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="a461cfbbb5c7a57ab73210498923cf615abe171d96ba8de66fb30e08c00211591e" />
<EnumerationListItem name="UMax">
&#42;p = old &gt;unsigned v ? old : v
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="a461cfbbb5c7a57ab73210498923cf615aa53854e09143f57d2ff2ad6ac89dc55d" />
<EnumerationListItem name="UMin">
&#42;p = old &lt;unsigned v ? old : v
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="a461cfbbb5c7a57ab73210498923cf615a08ef06068dcd583c2476568dda59b324" />
<EnumerationListItem name="FAdd">
&#42;p = old + v
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="a461cfbbb5c7a57ab73210498923cf615a92f66d4bc04fc8514bee80509f3e78d4" />
<EnumerationListItem name="FSub">
&#42;p = old - v
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="a461cfbbb5c7a57ab73210498923cf615acce124326ba87b0127b36c412bf555fd" />
<EnumerationListItem name="FMax">
&#42;p = maxnum(old, v) <code>maxnum</code> matches the behavior of <code><a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a636de400e4dd2bc090b729329a99e75b">llvm.maxnum</a></code>
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="a461cfbbb5c7a57ab73210498923cf615abd5e733a10a36f3572105b1a67538e18" />
<EnumerationListItem name="FMin">
&#42;p = minnum(old, v) <code>minnum</code> matches the behavior of <code><a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#aa656aa475d13ec6a900414eadabe86b0">llvm.minnum</a></code>
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="a461cfbbb5c7a57ab73210498923cf615a9334c9815ddc2b25804c6c03b68cc39b" />
<EnumerationListItem name="UIncWrap">
Increment one up to a maximum value
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="a461cfbbb5c7a57ab73210498923cf615ad3ed1a8c334bc3a50d59aaa57ee9e9f3" />
<EnumerationListItem name="UDecWrap">
Decrement one until a minimum value or zero
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="a461cfbbb5c7a57ab73210498923cf615a0f94e2ef083268e45d22a220f92567a4" />
<EnumerationListItem name="USubCond">
Subtract only if no unsigned overflow
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="a461cfbbb5c7a57ab73210498923cf615a7bf1abb23eccced685c706917aff605c" />
<EnumerationListItem name="USubSat">
&#42;p = usub.sat(old, v) <code>usub.sat</code> matches the behavior of <code>llvm.usub.sat</code>
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="a461cfbbb5c7a57ab73210498923cf615ad76dfbda6c10d959f44e01788b4c0f66" />
<EnumerationListItem name="FIRST_BINOP">
 (= Xchg)
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="a461cfbbb5c7a57ab73210498923cf615a4afdbe301c2ed66ac3752096b8962226" />
<EnumerationListItem name="LAST_BINOP">
 (= USubSat)
</EnumerationListItem>

<Link id="a461cfbbb5c7a57ab73210498923cf615a497e8f347648b1b2823ee0338c95f65f" />
<EnumerationListItem name="BAD_BINOP">

</EnumerationListItem>

</EnumerationList>

In the descriptions, &#39;p&#39; is the pointer to the instruction&#39;s memory location, &#39;old&#39; is the initial value of &#42;p, and &#39;v&#39; is the other value passed to the instruction. These instructions always return &#39;old&#39;.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/instructions-h/#l00716">716</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/instructions-h">Instructions.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>

### SSID {#abd37edff365a11a8942c156a26746dc0}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="SyncScope::ID llvm::AtomicRMWInst::SSID">
The synchronization scope <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#abdf8cf606905c10634e831390981b0ed">ID</a> of this rmw instruction.

Not quite enough room in SubClassData for everything, so synchronization scope <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#abdf8cf606905c10634e831390981b0ed">ID</a> gets its own field.
